summary.para: Get a pointer to a variable that contains depth-stencil state.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of depth-stencil-state descriptions. If there is only one depth-stencil variable in the effect, use 0.

param.name: pDepthStencilDesc
param.para: A pointer to a depth-stencil-state description (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. Backing store data can used to recreate the variable when necessary.

summary.para: Get a pointer to a depth-stencil interface.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of depth-stencil interfaces. If there is only one depth-stencil interface, use 0.

param.name: ppDepthStencilState
param.para: The address of a pointer to a blend-state interface (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: A depth-stencil-variable interface accesses depth-stencil state.

remarks.para: An ID3D10EffectDepthStencilVariable Interface is created when an effect is read into memory.

Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. You can use either of these methods to return state. For examples, see Two Ways to Get the State in an Effect Variable.
